About Us | Broad Brook Brewing Co. | Brewery | Tap Room | Patio Dining ↓ Skip to Main Content Broad Brook Brewing Company 915 South Street Suffield, CT 06078 860.623.1000 info@BroadBrookBrewing.com Hours of Operation: Mon: Closed Tues: Closed Wed: 4 PM – 9 PM Thu: 4 PM – 9 PM Fri: 11:30 AM – 9 PM Sat: 11:30 AM – 9 PM Sun: 11:30 AM – 8 PM Main Navigation Menu Home About Us Beers From Our Kitchen On Tap Brewery Contact News About Us Facebook Twitter Instagram Youtube About Broad Brook Brewing Company Born out of a garage in Broad Brook, Connecticut – Broad Brook Brewing Company got its start as a weekend hobby at Tom’s house. Home brewing was the perfect excuse to invite friends to watch sports and tinker with recipes. Eventually these gatherings became quite large and brews such as Broad Brook Ale became popular around town. After much insistence from friends and family to open an actual brewery, Tom and Eric teamed up with other home-brewing childhood pals and began entering beer competitions… and they started winning. By the time Broad Brook Brewing made it’s official debut in East Windsor in October 2013, we had already built a loyal fan base. After a few years “on tour” with a handful of award winning beers at Beer Festivals around Greater Hartford and Springfield, we opened our first brewery and taproom location in Sofia’s Plaza. Grand Opening Day was met with a line of local fans stretching out the door, ready to sample our beer in a real tap room. 241 Mug Club Memberships sold out the very first day. Soon the “beer boom” hit. It took only two and a half years to smash our ten year projections, outgrowing the facility. We simply couldn’t brew beer fast enough to keep up with demand from customers, bars, and distributors. In order to keep all of Connecticut & Western Mass stocked with our 30+ styles, we had to expand. After an exhaustive search for a larger facility in our home town, it was clear we needed to construct a brand new brewery. We found a property just across the CT River, and quickly began construction in Suffield, CT. Met with a multitude of challenges during construction, forces beyond our control led us to leave our first location in December 2017, prior to completion of the new building. More delays demanded that we get creative to stay alive. Our friends at Stony Creek Brewery were gracious enough to brew our three most popular styles and keep shelves stocked while we completed the project. The owners and staff had to return to their day jobs, and there were sometimes doubts that we would ever return. But after 30 months of being the brewery without a home, we hammered the final nails and opened for business in June 2020. (Right in the middle of a global pandemic.) Thanks to the support of our community, customers, and loyal beer fans, we have returned! Our new brewery and taproom at 915 South St, Suffield CT is now open for limited indoor + patio seating, just North of Bradley Airport. Our new facility is capable of brewing over 13,000 barrels a year, and packaging 300% more cans than previously possible. Our Mug Club has expanded to 300 members and we now have a full kitchen. Our new Executive Chef, Derek, has created a brand new menu offering brick oven pizzas, sandwiches, wings, charcuterie plates, and more. Our food menu changes frequently and many items are made with our current beers infused into the recipe. When the lock-downs lift, we plan to have beer dinners, breakfast, live music, yoga, comedy, and private parties. We are so excited just to be brewing beer again and can’t wait for you to visit the new taproom. Follow our social media pages for details on phased re-opening, food offerings, beer releases, events, and expanding hours. You can also sign up for our Newsletter .  Thank you for all of your patience and support. It wouldn’t have been possible without you. We are back, cheers! Our state of the art facility features two brewing systems, a 30 Barrel production system where we make almost 1000 gallons in a batch along with our 3 Barrel pilot system that makes 90 gallons in a batch. Quick Links About Us On Tap From Our Kitchen Beers Brewery Contact News About Us On Tap From Our Kitchen Beers Brewery Contact News Contact Us 915 South Street Suffield, CT  06078 860.623.1000 Info@BroadBrookBrewing.com Facebook Twitter Instagram Youtube ©  2025 Broad Brook Brewing Company

Close Overview Get Directions View On Larger Map Company Name Great Chicago Fire Brewery & Tap Room Visit Website https://chifibrew.com/ Online Social Profiles Phone Number 352-474-2739 Location 311 W Magnolia St. Leesburg , Florida , 34748 United States About Great Chicago Fire Brewery & Tap Room LEESBURG BREWERY WITH A CHICAGO FLAIR COME JOIN US……. The Great Chicago Fire Brewery & Tap Room, Leesburg Florida This a fun, friendly place to hang with friends and to me new ones. Our Chicago/Firefighter themed Tap Room offers 10 of our own hand-crafted beers brewed on premise. Enjoy our spacious outdoor beer garden and street side outdoor seating. Our daily menu can be compared to any one of a 100 hot dog joints in Chicago. Real Italian Beefs with Giardiniera peppers. Italian Sausage with sweet peppers. Maxwell Street Polish Sausage with grilled onions. Gyros off the spit with tomatoes, onions, and fresh tzatziki sauce. I can’t forget the original Chicago Hot Dog. All beef with onions, neon green relish, tomatoes, mustard, a pickle slice, sport peppers and celery salt. (Never any ketchup!) Meatball Subs with I Italian meatballs, our homemade marinara, topped with melted fresh mozzarella cheese, Pizza Puffs. Chicago Pizza goodness all wrapped up in dough and fried to perfection and last but not least, real Tom Tom Brand Tamales. We have added a true Thin Crust Chicago Pizza to our menu. A cracker thin crust with our own pizza sauce to the edge. We add your favorite toppings like Italian Sausage or Pepperoni and then cover it all with fresh Mozzarella Cheese. The crust and the cheese are baked to a golden brown and it is cut into squares, not slices. (Tavern cut) Now let’s talk about our beer. We brew “drinkable” beers. Simple beers that everyone can enjoy because we realize not everyone is a craft beer aficionado. Brewing in small batches, we can be creative, but not crazy in our beer choices. Craft beer not your thing? We also have many domestic beers, full liquor, and a selection of wines for your enjoyment. There is our "Cool Cars Under the Stars" cruise in on the Third Thursday of every month and our Downtown Leesburg Bike Night sponsored by our great friends @ GATOR HARLEY-DAVIDSON on the second Thursday of every month. We have plenty of parking and we are located in Historic Downtown Leesburg, which offers a great shopping experience with specialty shops, antique stores, and a host of unique food and drink establishments. It’s definitely worth the trip from Orlando or the Villages. Out on your motorcycle and need a bite to eat or to wet your whistle, this is the place! × Map View Get Directions Cancel FEATURED LISTINGS!
